metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28878 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, the Zip implementation calls__iterator_get_unchecked() more than once for the same index (under certainconditions) when next_back() and next() are used together. This bug couldlead to a memory safety violation due to an unmet safety requirement forthe TrustedRandomAccess trait.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.53 - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-all - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-clippy - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-gdb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-lldb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-src - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustc - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustfmt - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1').
